website_summaries.verdict: This bare-bones photo printer makes good-looking--albeit expensive--prints.
cons: No memory card slots or on-printer controls

customer_reviews.title: These printers are fantastic, and I am on my second one in ...
customer_reviews.text: These printers are fantastic, and I am on my second one in 10+ years. However, I am now running Windows 7, and this printer won't run on this OS. Does anyone have knowledge of where one might find Windows 7 compatible drivers for this printer, if it exists? Otherwise, I now have another dust catcher just like in the review of another customer.
customer_reviews.author: Doris I. Curran

customer_reviews.title: Never met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Will never buy any used item again in my lifetime I threw it away after it frustrated the hellout of me the print paper kept curling up sticking all the pictures were ruined. Wasted my expensive paper and print ribbon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are shape and the color is crisp and defined. It was easy to use and the price was right. I took about 1/2 minute for each picture to print. I'm a novice at photo printing and I had no problem. I highly recommend this device. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: The cost of the paper and toner is quite high though! I do not understand why all of the paper sizes are not available in all areas either!
customer_reviews.author: Sandman717

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY WITH NEW PRINTER. CUTS OFF HEADS
customer_reviews.text: I have the Sony camera and I have only used the Sony picture maker, to print off all my pictures. I have a new grandchild on the way and I plan on taking lots of precious pictures. Now I'm all set. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndy M.

customer_reviews.title: i have 2 Sony picture stations; neither will print ...
customer_reviews.text: i have 2 Sony picture stations; neither will print a full picture. I have the latest software for the products, but that did not help. Maybe it is the paper and ink packages I have and are too old. Right now I cannot print with either.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Oglesby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for such a carefully packed item. our printer had gone out and you had a good as new! Thank you again! D
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: A short review was sent about 10 days ago. The unit was broken. Thanks, George G
customer_reviews.author: George Gause

customer_reviews.title: I'm in Photo Printer Love.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Sony Printer and all I can say is Oh My Gosh!!! We have been working on a family history photo project for several years and have always used the HP printers and been pleased with their performance. I purchased my Sony DPP_FP30 to try something new (since HP's don't like refilled cartridges anymore). One photo printed and I am hooked and will never go back. The clarity and quality of the print is far beyond any I have ever been able to produce in the past. I wish the paper was a little less expensive but will look for a sale and stock up. Hands down and no questions asked I am thrilled with my new printer.
customer_reviews.author: rcrmm380

customer_reviews.title: Sony DPP-FP30 Digital Photo Printer ...
customer_reviews.text: They quit making the paper and ink for this thing, now on here and eBay, it is an arm and a leg to purchase! I got lucky and found a pack that someone opened and it didn't fit theirs. Other than that, I will not pay 75-85 bucks for a Print Pack. Now it will be useless!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn b.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT, GREAT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 3 years and use it all the time. I've had no problems with it and it still prints wonderful pictures. The only down side is that when I purchase the 40 picture pack, I usually have 1 picture paper left and I run out of ink, so I don't get my 40 prints, but the quality is so good that I like them better than if I go to CVS OR WAL MART.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam C. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: OK quality but breaks too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I was fine with the picture quality and print speed although the colors sometimes looked too intense. My gripe is that the printer stopped working before I could even reach 100 pictures. I've read online comments from others with the same problem of sections of the photo coming out white/blank. I've tried cleaning the print head, checking for visible loose/broken parts, and replacing the ink cartridge and paper several times to no avail. It's past the 1 yr warranty, so it'll be going out in my trash soon.
customer_reviews.author: Park

customer_reviews.title: The best so far... by far!
customer_reviews.text: Besides the expensive ink and paper (although value packs are available now), this little devil is a charm with a cherry on top! It is a bit more expensive than other dye-sub printers, but once you try it out you'll realize it's worth it. One leasson I learned, never go cheap on dye-sub photo printers, they're worth every penny and the DPP-FP30 rules them all.
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a few months now and I've never seen a better one!! The pictures look as good as the ones I got from a photoshop here in town. If I could give it more stars I would! The only problem I've found so far is that they print on postcards. You wouldnt know it til you turned it over, but still.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures but issues with product
customer_reviews.text: This printer does print excellent pictures, but I've had it less than a year and had to send it in for cleaning already, which I had to pay the shipping. The utility that they used to clean it is impossible for the consumer to access, so you have to send it in. I've purchased two printing packs which were supposed to produce 80 pictures each. I only have 90 pictures to show for it. I'm waiting for Sony to resolve the situation. My husband bought it for me for Mother's Day, so I could print our baby's pictures easily. He might be sending it back asking for our money back.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Girl

customer_reviews.title: great little printer
customer_reviews.text: nice, small, compact printer. quality of the photos is great using dye sublimation printing. fun to watch the picture come together color by color. a little time consuming, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pesty

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing. I don't know why it is so cheap. The pictures are great, it is compact, and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: FamousActor143

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my third "photo" printer and probably my last. Great Great Great...read the other reviews for more details...I agree on every point.
customer_reviews.author: T.B.

product_meta.title: Sony DPP-FP30 Digital Photo Printer
feature_bullets: Prints a 4-by-6-inch photo in about 90 seconds to 2 minutes
Photos are resistant to fingerprints, water, and fading
USB 2.0 interface, PictBridge compatible; Windows compatible

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars21 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
